body_html:
In the c10 library PR I got rid of one level of nesting so instead of c10/c10 it's c10. Can we apply this treatment here as well?

Also, we absolutely need this wired up to CI to evaluate the PRs adequately, because, for example, MSVC may choke on some of the more advanced C++ features we are using, and MSVC is a hard blocker for merging.
body_text:
In the c10 library PR I got rid of one level of nesting so instead of c10/c10 it's c10. Can we apply this treatment here as well?
Also, we absolutely need this wired up to CI to evaluate the PRs adequately, because, for example, MSVC may choke on some of the more advanced C++ features we are using, and MSVC is a hard blocker for merging.
body:
In the c10 library PR I got rid of one level of nesting so instead of `c10/c10` it's `c10`. Can we apply this treatment here as well?

Also, we absolutely need this wired up to CI to evaluate the PRs adequately, because, for example, MSVC may choke on some of the more advanced C++ features we are using, and MSVC is a **hard blocker** for merging.
